Miller and Helft report, Google, which has 24,400 employees, is no longer considered by many top engineers as the most desirable place to work in the Valley; a new generation of start-ups has taken that place... Mr. Page led the company in its early days but relinquished that role in 2001, when it was still private. In tapping him to return to the post, Google becomes one of the few major companies in the Valley to be put under the control of a founder after being run for so long by a professional manager. Which mediocrity-at-best-fest is more addicted copying Apple, Microsoft or Google? It's a contest. Gatesy will be back next.
